issue.title: Release.Namespace and Release.Time in charts repo but missing from Helm v3

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
The dev-v3 branch, as of c62a3a4896e7f6af57c7282c4415f523195523d4, no longer has `.Release.Namespace` and `.Release.Time` available in templates. It appears this was changed in https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/aa859e3f88291c94220d26e9d1127c1557c2af98 in order to "make template rendering discrete and repeatable".

There are some problems with this.

1. Charts in the charts repo use both of these features. See [`.Release.Time` here](https://github.com/helm/charts/search?q=Release.Time&unscoped_q=Release.Time) and [`.Release.Namespace` here](https://github.com/helm/charts/search?q=Release.Namespace&unscoped_q=Release.Namespace). These charts won't work with Helm v3
2. `.Release.Namespace` is needed for RBAC. Removing it hinders the ability of a chart to create RBAC config. See the comment on the commit and how it's used in the charts repo. Removal of namespace limits what charts can be used for

This was referenced in https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/4255#issuecomment-399491963 where @adamreese said it would be added back.

cc @bacongobbler @adamreese

body:
I would like to work on this. 
Can you assign this to me ?

cc @hickeyma  @mattfarina @bacongobbler

Removing `.Release.Revision` is definitely going to break us. We have a Helm pre-install,pre-upgrade hook provision a credential for the revision and store it in a secret with `.Release.Revision` in its name. We then have other templates refer to that secret.

With templates still being able to query the time, it looks like the purpose of [aa859e3](https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/aa859e3f88291c94220d26e9d1127c1557c2af98) has not been achieved.

issue.title: feat(lint): Adds v3 chart checks to linter

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
Fixes #5733

This adds two specific checks. A warning if a chart has a `crd-install` hook
and an error if the chart contains `.Release.Time`. Further checks can be added
down the road as needed using the same pattern I use here

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body: Thanks for bringing that to our attention, @johngmyers. @jlegrone had similar concerns with fetching database backups during a rollback in relation to a particular release. `.Release.Revision` is being added back in #6688.
